meanings.definition: To use force or influence to make someone do something.
meanings.sent1: She was muscling her way through the crowd to get to the front.
meanings.sent2: He was muscling the heavy box up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was muscling her friends into playing her favorite game.
meanings.sent4: The politician was muscling his opponents out of the race.
meanings.sent5: The coach was muscling the team to victory with his motivational speeches.

meanings.definition: To move or push something with physical strength.
meanings.sent1: The weightlifter was muscling the barbell above his head.
meanings.sent2: She was muscling the stubborn door open.
meanings.sent3: The cat was muscling the toy mouse around the room.
meanings.sent4: The wind was muscling the trees in the storm.
meanings.sent5: He was muscling the car out of the mud with sheer determination.

meanings.definition: The physical power and strength of a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: His muscling was evident in the way he effortlessly lifted the heavy rock.
meanings.sent2: The lion's muscling was intimidating as it prowled through the grass.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's muscling made it difficult for the little girl to hold onto the leash.
meanings.sent4: The muscling of the elephant was a sight to behold as it gracefully moved through the savanna.
meanings.sent5: The muscling of the wrestler was unmatched in the ring.
